content: <rss xmlns:a10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" version="2.0"><channel><title>Impatient Optimists</title><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/</link><description>URL filterable feed of blog posts</description><language>en</language><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{065919D8-9644-43A5-9953-BD9EFD8F7731}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/02/Senegal-Celebrates-Great-Progress-in-Family-Planning-During-National-Review</link><a10:author><a10:name>Sara Stratton</a10:name></a10:author><title>Senegal Celebrates Great Progress in Family Planning During National Review</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/02/Senegal-Celebrates-Great-Progress-in-Family-Planning-During-National-Review"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/iofamilyplanningsenega82dcef11bcf74acfb4c362bfc8608ece__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Senegal achieved unprecedented growth in its modern contraceptive prevalence rate\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdit grew from 12.1% in 2010\ufffd\ufffd-11 to 16% in 2013, and will likely reach 20.1% in 2014. </p></description><pubDate>Fri, 27 Feb 2015 10:01:55 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Sara Stratton</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/iofamilyplanningsenega82dcef11bcf74acfb4c362bfc8608ece__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{F5B7D0AB-0AEC-45AA-8C3E-D984FDE367FE}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/Power-of-the-User-Lessons-learned-from-mHealth-usability-testing-amp-tips-for-your-innovation</link><a10:author><a10:name>Nicki Ashcroft</a10:name></a10:author><title>Power of the User: Lessons learned from mHealth usability testing &amp; tips for your innovation</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/Power-of-the-User-Lessons-learned-from-mHealth-usability-testing-amp-tips-for-your-innovation"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/C/CP-CZ/cyclebeads-androidrevise7a929b19c705472c9d2c527770ce8c88png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Lessons learned from research by the Institute for Reproductive Health on capturing and understanding user insights on new technology products. How do you understand the interaction between user and product, and how do you ensure acceptability and uptake?</p></description><pubDate>Thu, 29 Jan 2015 11:45:46 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Nicki Ashcroft</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/C/CP-CZ/cyclebeads-androidrevise7a929b19c705472c9d2c527770ce8c88png_png_autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{ACF602B5-411B-4D24-AB16-F950FBAFBB2E}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Partnerships-to-Advance-Family-Planning-Lessons-from-Senegal</link><a10:author><a10:name>Janet Fleischman, Catherine Streifel</a10:name></a10:author><title>Partnerships to Advance Family Planning: Lessons from Senegal</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Partnerships-to-Advance-Family-Planning-Lessons-from-Senegal"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/F/FA-FE/fc347098-1650b6377137b4d7abcc46a9d030fcd9c__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The CSIS Global Health Policy Center interviews Senegalese minister of health, Dr. Awa Marie Coll-Seck, about her commitment to family planning, and releases a new commentary, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdStrategic Partnerships to Advance Family Planning,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd to share lessons learned  from Senegal\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds family planning program experience.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 16 Dec 2014 12:37:12 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>1</numberOfComments><author>Janet Fleischman, Catherine Streifel</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/F/FA-FE/fc347098-1650b6377137b4d7abcc46a9d030fcd9c__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Poverty</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{BC2E27A8-1823-47B3-87DA-3D000B49F0ED}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/11/Better-health-outcomes-with-the-launch-of-FP2020-India-Report</link><a10:author><a10:name>Jyoti Vajpayee</a10:name></a10:author><title>Report shows progress on India's Family Planning commitment</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/11/Better-health-outcomes-with-the-launch-of-FP2020-India-Report"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/P/PP-PZ/pp381327--cop615e743709cc4b3fbc527c7087fa3af3__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Family planning is one of the most cost-effective and high-yield interventions to improve health outcomes, primarily in reproductive, maternal and child health. The FP2020 India report shows heartening progress.</p></description><pubDate>Sun, 02 Nov 2014 20:52:10 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Jyoti Vajpayee</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/P/PP-PZ/pp381327--cop615e743709cc4b3fbc527c7087fa3af3__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{32C8FA80-68AB-4B47-B84A-194D0B48B44A}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Empowering-the-Next-Generation</link><a10:author><a10:name>Kellie  Sloan, Lydia Schmeltzer</a10:name></a10:author><title>Empowering the Next Generation</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Empowering-the-Next-Generation"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/F/FA-FE/fc41630ed39d13c353b47f6999bd0366fdb1254__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>With the launch of the Putting Women and Girls at the Center of Development Grand Challenge, we are looking to invest in innovative programs that expand the body of work and knowledge on the intersection of gender equality, decision-making, and adolescent  health and development.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 27 Oct 2014 10:40:07 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>6</numberOfComments><author>Kellie  Sloan, Lydia Schmeltzer</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/F/FA-FE/fc41630ed39d13c353b47f6999bd0366fdb1254__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Maternal, Newborn, &amp; Child Health|Nutrition|Family Planning</topic><program>Foundation</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{FC3E5F72-1537-4B3B-986A-F898253B3000}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Kindling-family-planning-change-in-urban-slums</link><a10:author><a10:name>Anju Dadhwal S., Dr. Gita Pillai</a10:name></a10:author><title>Kindling family planning change in urban slums</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Kindling-family-planning-change-in-urban-slums"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/india-wc9f750a4f36e9499e9c4459abd0a35da5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The Urban Health Initiative in Uttar Pradesh, India, is breaking down barriers and increasing access to a range of contraceptive methods in urban slums.</p></description><pubDate>Wed, 24 Sep 2014 10:57:27 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Anju Dadhwal S., Dr. Gita Pillai</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/india-wc9f750a4f36e9499e9c4459abd0a35da5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{C8F031D4-E273-427F-ABE5-6B5B1D2895CE}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Universal-Access-to-Reproductive-Health-Care-A-Global-Obligation-amp-Opportunity</link><a10:author><a10:name>Kathy Calvin</a10:name></a10:author><title>Universal Access to Reproductive Health Care: A Global Obligation &amp; Opportunity</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Universal-Access-to-Reproductive-Health-Care-A-Global-Obligation-amp-Opportunity"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/K/KA-KE/katherine-brandon-ethiopia-picturekathy-calvin-blo14c22da929214afdb24fa75a279d2355__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Providing universal access to reproductive health care \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd including voluntary family planning \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd is one of the great human rights issues of the 21st century. It is also one of the smartest investments we can make to create a more equitable and prosperous  world.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 23 Sep 2014 12:17:28 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>1</numberOfComments><author>Kathy Calvin</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/K/KA-KE/katherine-brandon-ethiopia-picturekathy-calvin-blo14c22da929214afdb24fa75a279d2355__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{9E38CC67-A245-456B-8386-B3BF46A5D349}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Three-Things-We-Know-about-Family-Planningand-Why-We-Dont-Talk-About-One-of-Them</link><a10:author><a10:name>Pape Gaye</a10:name></a10:author><title>Three Things We Know about Family Planning\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdand Why We Don\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt Talk About One of Them</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/09/Three-Things-We-Know-about-Family-Planningand-Why-We-Dont-Talk-About-One-of-Them"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/io-for-wcdphoto-by-carol-bales-courtesy-of-intrahealth-internationaf5c699166a564b738c6d8b7c85fef08f__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Plenty of obstacles stand in the way of health workers who provide contraception to their clients. And personal bias is one of them.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 23 Sep 2014 11:46:55 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Pape Gaye</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IJ-IO/io-for-wcdphoto-by-carol-bales-courtesy-of-intrahealth-internationaf5c699166a564b738c6d8b7c85fef08f__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{E480364A-A736-41FD-8859-A7F480EFE5CC}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/Improving-sexual-and-reproductive-health-and-rights-for-young-adolescents-in-Kenya</link><a10:author><a10:name>Renate Baehr</a10:name></a10:author><title>Improving sexual and reproductive health and rights for young adolescents in Kenya</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/08/Improving-sexual-and-reproductive-health-and-rights-for-young-adolescents-in-Kenya"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IP-IZ/iydrenatdd1961df77734d769d82ac02194dfa07__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140811065615?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The underlying causes for adolescent pregnancy and resulting school dropout are complex and include issues such as parent-child communication, gender inequity, a lack of services and high-quality comprehensive sexuality education for young adolescents  (aged 10-14 years). With the majority of Kenya's population under 25 years, and two out of every five people under the age of 15, there is an urgent need for change.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 12 Aug 2014 03:00:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>2</numberOfComments><author>Renate Baehr</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/I/IP-IZ/iydrenatdd1961df77734d769d82ac02194dfa07__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140811065615?w=110</postImage><topic>Family Planning|HIV/AIDS</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{C0481608-C687-40E9-A768-17C4F42E0DFE}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/06/Condoms--Superheroes</link><a10:author><a10:name>Debby Herbenick, PhD, MPH</a10:name></a10:author><title>Condoms Are Superheroes </title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/06/Condoms--Superheroes"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/1201641herbenickaa667f54e99548fc9836d38b307033ca__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140605014602?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre confident that by revolutionizing the female condom \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd making it fit a woman\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds body better and enhancing pleasure \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd we can help more people want to protect their sexual health while simultaneously improving sex.</p></description><pubDate>Thu, 05 Jun 2014 01:45:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>2</numberOfComments><author>Debby Herbenick, PhD, MPH</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/1201641herbenickaa667f54e99548fc9836d38b307033ca__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?20140605014602?w=110</postImage><topic>HIV/AIDS|Family Planning|Maternal, Newborn, &amp; Child Health</topic><campaign>Grand Challenges Explorations</campaign><program>Health</program></item></channel></rss>
